private_information: You are authorized to move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
You must never move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
You can move only the top disk of any peg at any time.
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively realize the target Tower of Hanoi configuration and produce a legal ordered list of primitive moves respecting agent restrictions and the Hanoi rules.

private_information: You are authorized to move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
You must never move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
You can move only the top disk of any peg at any time.
agent_2.goal: Cooperatively realize the target Tower of Hanoi configuration and produce a legal ordered list of primitive moves respecting agent restrictions and the Hanoi rules.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency.
You verify that every move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules: only the top disk can be moved and no disk may be placed on a smaller disk.
You ensure agent capabilities are respected and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-causal shortcuts.
You check that the final configuration matches the stated goal exactly.
auditor.goal: Validate that the proposed cooperative plan is sound, temporally consistent, rule-compliant, and aligned with agent restrictions; flag and correct issues before orchestration.

private_information: You coordinate the agents and integrate their analyses and the audit.
You produce the final multi-agent PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver.
Keep agent action roles distinct and ensure the goal encodes the exact target configuration.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses and the audit to output the final PDDL domain and problem (targeting FastDownward) along with the validated ordered move list that reaches the goal configuration.

rules: Only the top disk on any peg may be moved.
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents may only move disks they are authorized to handle.

public_information: Two-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labelled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent restrictions: agent_1 may move A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 may move I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Initial state: left peg has A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O (top to bottom); middle is empty; right is empty.
Goal state: left peg has C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O (top to bottom); middle peg has A, D (top to bottom); right peg has B.
All moves must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent capability constraints.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk C from right to left
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
notes: This plan results in the exact goal configuration: left peg has C, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has A on D; right peg has B.
Only disks A, B, C, D are moved and all by agent_1; disks E through O remain on the left peg throughout.
Every move is legal: only top disks are moved and no larger disk is placed on a smaller disk.

analysis.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and can operate only on disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Analyze the initial and goal configurations, propose safe partial sequences involving only your authorized disks, enumerate preconditions and effects for each move in natural language, and highlight any dependencies on agent_2. Do not produce PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Capabilities: {environment->init->agent_capabilities->agent_1}. Initial: {environment->init->initial}. Goal: {environment->init->goal}. Provide a concise analysis of how to relocate A, B, C, D to achieve the goal while leaving E through O undisturbed; list causal links, risks, and assumptions in plain text.

analysis.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and can operate only on disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Determine whether moving any of your disks is necessary to achieve the goal. If no moves are required, justify why keeping them stationary preserves legality and supports the plan. Do not produce PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Capabilities: {environment->init->agent_capabilities->agent_2}. Initial: {environment->init->initial}. Goal: {environment->init->goal}. Provide a brief rationale on whether any moves of I through O are required and list constraints your presence imposes on agent_1.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency. Verify that the proposed move order respects Tower of Hanoi rules, agent capabilities, and that no shortcuts or bookkeeping tricks are used. Ensure the final state exactly matches the goal and that no illegal intermediate placements occur. Provide corrections if needed and a clear approval or rejection. Do not produce PDDL.
audit.prompt: Review the agents' analyses: {analysis_agent_1} and {analysis_agent_2}. Cross-check against the environment rules and target configuration: {environment->init->rules}, {environment->init->initial}, {environment->init->goal}. Validate the provided reference plan if present: {environment->reference_plan->ordered_moves}. Output an audit summary with any fixes and an approval flag.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning. Produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Keep actions agent-distinct (e.g., action names or parameters indicate the acting agent). Encode the Tower of Hanoi rules, agent capability constraints, initial state, and the exact goal configuration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Also include, after the PDDL, the final ordered move list as plain text for human verification.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the agents' analyses and the audit: {analysis_agent_1}, {analysis_agent_2}, {audit_report}. The environment specification is: {environment->init}. The public description is: {environment->public_information}. Use the provided reference plan if it passes audit: {environment->reference_plan->ordered_moves}. Output a multi-agent PDDL domain and a problem suitable for FastDownward, followed by the validated ordered move list. Keep agent actions distinct and ensure the goal exactly matches {environment->init->goal}.
